text: a giass says his prayers every day at
the mosque and then he goes to church
he's helping to build a place of worship
for his Christian neighbors and hoping
they can live together in peace a big
dream in Pakistan where religious
minorities are often under attack after
local rights we are trying to bring
people together even more we have
increased our activities so we don't
have to face something like that by
building this church we want to show
that we are united as a community for al
maseeh is a Christian he does not share
the same faith as a Jos but they share a
childhood friendship that is beyond
religion unlike in other parts of
Pakistan
there is no segregated housing for
Christian residents in this village they
live side by side with their Muslim
neighbors since my childhood we have all
lived together in this one place we live
with love attend each other's weddings
and festivals we are together in times
of happiness and grief I pray that we
never have to go through what happened
in Goa this village is a stone's throw
from Gojira where in 2009 religious mobs
attacked the Christian community ten
people were killed there churches and
houses torched and reduced to ashes
these people have not forgotten the
violence of the past but they're
determined to prove that communal
violence can be defeated by individual
acts of love
this go Mitch what is wrong with this
church being built in a small village by
the Muslims it is very significant it
shows that people have love in their
hearts they want to stay together if
there are those that fuel the fire there
are also those who douse the flames all
the scarred by the memories of the
Gojira mob attacks these people have not
lost hope they're not just building a
church together they're building hope
for interfaith harmony and the hope that
if they can make it happen where they
live one day it can be implemented
everywhere in Pakistan Saba is ours
BBC News goodra
